output.map_title: Map to show the number of graduates of all subjects now working in Education who are currently living in each region three years after graduation, male and female level 7 (research) graduates from English HEIs, APs and FECs, 2018/19 tax year.
output.maptext: For level 7 (research) graduates of all subjects in the Education industry three years after graduation, the region where the most graduates had studied was East of England. The region where the least graduates had studied was East Midlands. The region where the highest number of graduates lived 3 years after graduation was South East and the region with the least graduates lived was North East.
output.maptext2: For level 7 (research) graduates of all subjects in the Education industry, the region with the highest proportionate increase in graduates who studied compared to living in the region three years after graduation was East Midlands, where the number of graduates increased by 209.8%. The region with the largest decrease is North East where the number of graduates decreased by -87.9%.
